body: I HAVE FUCKING HAD IT! NOT **ONE** OTHER PERSON HERE HAS A SINGLE FAULT EXCEPT FOR ME! I can't do anything right. Even the smallest things I try to do fall apart immediately, and everyone else just keeps moving along achieving pretty much anything they want if they set their mind to it. Sure, they fail some, but at least not all the time! And I've had it with everyone trying to sugarcoat it and make it seem like it's not a big deal, because it is. Whenever there's any kind of group project or organization, guess who's the only one not invited every single time? You guessed it, it's me! And they're not bullying me, it's because they know at a subconscious level that I'm not worth the dust beneath my paws, even the ones who have tried to deny this know it, and their actions prove it. Stop lying to me, the evidence is right in front of all of us! Not one thing I attempt ever finishes, and even if it would it'd be a huge mess and so much less than everyone else can do in a fraction of the time and effort. Now you may say, "Oh, I couldn't do what you did!". But you've never tried or been interested have you? Exactly. I don't and can't do even *one thing* halfway decently. Don't give me that 10000 hours crap or whatever, it hasn't worked at all for me and no one else even needs it. It's a myth, and even science has proven that, along with common sense. Practice accounts for maybe 0.1-10% of the difference, the rest is just innate intelligence that you have to be born with, not a fucking thing you can do about it. And everyone here has that in every field except me! I don't even know *one* other person who has this problem, I'm completely alone. Here everyone else is doing all sorts of crazy things and I can't even find a fox picture on the internet after searching for 2 hours with years of experience. I'm always out of the loop, super dull, can barely even think. I do a few things somewhat well but I'm faking it. They consist of a few specific things I've seen other people do and copying it robotically, with literally no understanding. I literally can't do *anything* else. Everyone else can at least do the thing they've been doing all the time for years, usually more than that, but me, nope, not even mediocre at one fucking thing! Not one hobby, not one game, not one subject, nothing! I'm uncharismatic, dull, forgetful, and just utterly incompetent! I'm a born loser, a wannabe in every way, and I just don't know how to play these cards! I get nothing but frustration and failure. This is so fucking unfair! The only thing I'm good at is burdening people with my problems. I used to have a some creativity at least when I was young but of course that went away as I got older and went through puberty and I can't ever even have that back! Damnit, what am I ever going to do with this situation! If I only knew even one other person on the whole planet who could sympathize with me. But no, you're all perfect and flawless and have superpowers compared to me, in real life and online. I need to give up on everything, my every effort is 100% in vain. But I'm not a passive consumer, and I can't just do that! Why am I like that when I don't have what it takes? I have no peace with myself, I can't just accept it, I don't want to waste my whole life in this miserable state. Someone please help me, I am falling apart! And please don't try to feed me more sugarcoated politically correct nonsense, that is not helping! Please, is there anything I can do escape this frustration and have joy in life?

post.title: Why am I the only one who isn't perfect?

body: You'll probably dismiss what I say because you've heard it before, and that's fine, but it's the truth. Not one person on this planet is good at everything, they may be able to portray it that way, but it's an act. People want to show themselves in the best way possible and they'll go through a lot of effort to make it seem like they're some sort of superhuman, but they aren't, not even close. Now as for what you can do to help yourself: I'd recommend just doing some things for fun, try different things out and see how it goes. Don't worry about if people seem better than you or if you're not grasping things immediately, very few people do. Persistence is key to a lot of things and I know you say you don't believe it but it can really help you become more comfortable with something you had no concept of at all beforehand. Stick to it, and pedal on at your own pace. Don't worry about what other people are doing, because in their heads, they're trying so hard to make themselves look good.

People want to show themselves in the best way possible and they'll go through a lot of effort to make it seem like they're some sort of superhuman, but they aren't, not even close. Now as for what you can do to help yourself: I'd recommend just doing some things for fun, try different things out and see how it goes. Don't worry about if people seem better than you or if you're not grasping things immediately, very few people do. Persistence is key to a lot of things and I know you say you don't believe it but it can really help you become more comfortable with something you had no concept of at all beforehand. Stick to it, and pedal on at your own pace. Don't worry about what other people are doing, because in their heads, they're trying so hard to make themselves look good.

> Not one person on this planet is good at everything, they may be able to portray it that way, but it's an act. People want to show themselves in the best way possible and they'll go through a lot of effort to make it seem like they're some sort of superhuman, but they aren't, not even close.

Yeah, you can't do everything, but you can do the things you put effort into, unless you're me. And it's not an act, because I've watched them do things effortlessly many times.

> very few people do

Evidently not, since everyone but me is doing it.

> Persistence is key to a lot of things and I know you say you don't believe it but it can really help you become more comfortable with something you had no concept of at all beforehand.

Comfortable yes. Better no.

> Stick to it, and pedal on at your own pace.

You're assuming I'm moving at all. This is my ceiling. I know that's hard to believe, but my progress has stopped.

> they're trying so hard to make themselves look good.

Some of them may be, but I know a lot who aren't, and I can tell that they're truly not. And even the ones who are still have to be able to do the things to look good.

parent.body: You'll probably dismiss what I say because you've heard it before, and that's fine, but it's the truth. Not one person on this planet is good at everything, they may be able to portray it that way, but it's an act. People want to show themselves in the best way possible and they'll go through a lot of effort to make it seem like they're some sort of superhuman, but they aren't, not even close. Now as for what you can do to help yourself: I'd recommend just doing some things for fun, try different things out and see how it goes. Don't worry about if people seem better than you or if you're not grasping things immediately, very few people do. Persistence is key to a lot of things and I know you say you don't believe it but it can really help you become more comfortable with something you had no concept of at all beforehand. Stick to it, and pedal on at your own pace. Don't worry about what other people are doing, because in their heads, they're trying so hard to make themselves look good.
parent.body_html: You'll probably dismiss what I say because you've heard it before, and that's fine, but it's the truth. Not one person on this planet is good at everything, they may be able to portray it that way, but it's an act. People want to show themselves in the best way possible and they'll go through a lot of effort to make it seem like they're some sort of superhuman, but they aren't, not even close. Now as for what you can do to help yourself: I'd recommend just doing some things for fun, try different things out and see how it goes. Don't worry about if people seem better than you or if you're not grasping things immediately, very few people do. Persistence is key to a lot of things and I know you say you don't believe it but it can really help you become more comfortable with something you had no concept of at all beforehand. Stick to it, and pedal on at your own pace. Don't worry about what other people are doing, because in their heads, they're trying so hard to make themselves look good.

post.body: I HAVE FUCKING HAD IT! NOT **ONE** OTHER PERSON HERE HAS A SINGLE FAULT EXCEPT FOR ME! I can't do anything right. Even the smallest things I try to do fall apart immediately, and everyone else just keeps moving along achieving pretty much anything they want if they set their mind to it. Sure, they fail some, but at least not all the time! And I've had it with everyone trying to sugarcoat it and make it seem like it's not a big deal, because it is. Whenever there's any kind of group project or organization, guess who's the only one not invited every single time? You guessed it, it's me! And they're not bullying me, it's because they know at a subconscious level that I'm not worth the dust beneath my paws, even the ones who have tried to deny this know it, and their actions prove it. Stop lying to me, the evidence is right in front of all of us! Not one thing I attempt ever finishes, and even if it would it'd be a huge mess and so much less than everyone else can do in a fraction of the time and effort. Now you may say, "Oh, I couldn't do what you did!". But you've never tried or been interested have you? Exactly. I don't and can't do even *one thing* halfway decently. Don't give me that 10000 hours crap or whatever, it hasn't worked at all for me and no one else even needs it. It's a myth, and even science has proven that, along with common sense. Practice accounts for maybe 0.1-10% of the difference, the rest is just innate intelligence that you have to be born with, not a fucking thing you can do about it. And everyone here has that in every field except me! I don't even know *one* other person who has this problem, I'm completely alone. Here everyone else is doing all sorts of crazy things and I can't even find a fox picture on the internet after searching for 2 hours with years of experience. I'm always out of the loop, super dull, can barely even think. I do a few things somewhat well but I'm faking it. They consist of a few specific things I've seen other people do and copying it robotically, with literally no understanding. I literally can't do *anything* else. Everyone else can at least do the thing they've been doing all the time for years, usually more than that, but me, nope, not even mediocre at one fucking thing! Not one hobby, not one game, not one subject, nothing! I'm uncharismatic, dull, forgetful, and just utterly incompetent! I'm a born loser, a wannabe in every way, and I just don't know how to play these cards! I get nothing but frustration and failure. This is so fucking unfair! The only thing I'm good at is burdening people with my problems. I used to have a some creativity at least when I was young but of course that went away as I got older and went through puberty and I can't ever even have that back! Damnit, what am I ever going to do with this situation! If I only knew even one other person on the whole planet who could sympathize with me. But no, you're all perfect and flawless and have superpowers compared to me, in real life and online. I need to give up on everything, my every effort is 100% in vain. But I'm not a passive consumer, and I can't just do that! Why am I like that when I don't have what it takes? I have no peace with myself, I can't just accept it, I don't want to waste my whole life in this miserable state. Someone please help me, I am falling apart! And please don't try to feed me more sugarcoated politically correct nonsense, that is not helping! Please, is there anything I can do escape this frustration and have joy in life?

body:
> I can't even find a fox picture on the internet after searching for 2 hours with years of experience.

Like, you can't choose any of them or what?

Have you tested or some sort of learning disability or whatever else? I imagine knowing what's wrong with you could help in overcoming it. IF it's *really* as bad as you say. Because from experience, I know you tend to be a lot harsher on yourself than you deserve to be during the depressed moods. Everyone's just kinda faking it through life.

body:
I don't think it's a learning disability, I can learn to copy other people like a robot just fine. I think it's that I'm just stupid and can't think for myself. But unfortunately most people think I'm really smart because they never bothered trying the things I did. But if they did they'd instantly zoom past me. Out of those who *do* have any interest, even mild, I'm always the lowest of the low. And it bothers me because I want to do things, mostly just for myself, and I can never get anything done but hours of frustration. And everyone else does it all the time just fine, usually well enough that it looks professional to me. And it takes a fraction of the time it does me.

> Like, you can't choose any of them or what?

I can't even find new ones at all, something everyone else in +foxes does multiple times a day with zero effort. And even when I do then I can't make up a good title because my brain doesn't work.

Don't give me that 10000 hours crap or whatever, it hasn't worked at all for me and no one else even needs it. It's a myth, and even science has proven that, along with common sense. Practice accounts for maybe 0.1-10% of the difference, the rest is just innate intelligence that you have to be born with, not a fucking thing you can do about it. And everyone here has that in every field except me! I don't even know *one* other person who has this problem, I'm completely alone. Here everyone else is doing all sorts of crazy things and I can't even find a fox picture on the internet after searching for 2 hours with years of experience. I'm always out of the loop, super dull, can barely even think. I do a few things somewhat well but I'm faking it. They consist of a few specific things I've seen other people do and copying it robotically, with literally no understanding. I literally can't do *anything* else. Everyone else can at least do the thing they've been doing all the time for years, usually more than that, but me, nope, not even mediocre at one fucking thing! Not one hobby, not one game, not one subject, nothing! I'm uncharismatic, dull, forgetful, and just utterly incompetent! I'm a born loser, a wannabe in every way, and I just don't know how to play these cards! I get nothing but frustration and failure. This is so fucking unfair! The only thing I'm good at is burdening people with my problems. I used to have a some creativity at least when I was young but of course that went away as I got older and went through puberty and I can't ever even have that back! Damnit, what am I ever going to do with this situation! If I only knew even one other person on the whole planet who could sympathize with me. But no, you're all perfect and flawless and have superpowers compared to me, in real life and online. I need to give up on everything, my every effort is 100% in vain. But I'm not a passive consumer, and I can't just do that! Why am I like that when I don't have what it takes? I have no peace with myself, I can't just accept it, I don't want to waste my whole life in this miserable state. Someone please help me, I am falling apart! And please don't try to feed me more sugarcoated politically correct nonsense, that is not helping! Please, is there anything I can do escape this frustration and have joy in life?

parent.body:
> Not one person on this planet is good at everything, they may be able to portray it that way, but it's an act. People want to show themselves in the best way possible and they'll go through a lot of effort to make it seem like they're some sort of superhuman, but they aren't, not even close.

Yeah, you can't do everything, but you can do the things you put effort into, unless you're me. And it's not an act, because I've watched them do things effortlessly many times.

> very few people do

Evidently not, since everyone but me is doing it.

> Persistence is key to a lot of things and I know you say you don't believe it but it can really help you become more comfortable with something you had no concept of at all beforehand.

Comfortable yes. Better no.

> Stick to it, and pedal on at your own pace.

You're assuming I'm moving at all. This is my ceiling. I know that's hard to believe, but my progress has stopped.

> they're trying so hard to make themselves look good.

Some of them may be, but I know a lot who aren't, and I can tell that they're truly not. And even the ones who are still have to be able to do the things to look good.

author.bio: Hi there, I'm Reverie, or Gray, whatever you prefer. I'm just here to look at memes and pretty pictures but sometimes I might comment on things. Sometimes my opinions, sometimes stupid thoughts, or both in one.
author.bio_html: Hi there, I'm Reverie, or Gray, whatever you prefer. I'm just here to look at memes and pretty pictures but sometimes I might comment on things. Sometimes my opinions, sometimes stupid thoughts, or both in one.

body:
Sounds like we're twins or something. I know how it's like, no one is equal, and we just so happened to be born as people below average and there's nothing we can do about it. The only way I keep on going is pretty much trying to kill off my emotions, but even I still feel bad every now and then, no matter how hard I try not to feel like most people tell me, I've been trying for years and I'm still feeling upset I can't do what most people do and my subhuman status makes me undeserving of what most people have. But I do hope maybe one day you'll find something you can do, something you don't dread and is productive.

Also shameless advertising but there's always +Venting if you wanna let out anything there.
body_html:
Sounds like we're twins or something. I know how it's like, no one is equal, and we just so happened to be born as people below average and there's nothing we can do about it. The only way I keep on going is pretty much trying to kill off my emotions, but even I still feel bad every now and then, no matter how hard I try not to feel like most people tell me, I've been trying for years and I'm still feeling upset I can't do what most people do and my subhuman status makes me undeserving of what most people have. But I do hope maybe one day you'll find something you can do, something you don't dread and is productive.

Also shameless advertising but there's always +Venting if you wanna let out anything there.

guild.description: The yanking feature should not exist.
guild.name: Vacuum

post.body: I HAVE FUCKING HAD IT! NOT **ONE** OTHER PERSON HERE HAS A SINGLE FAULT EXCEPT FOR ME! I can't do anything right. Even the smallest things I try to do fall apart immediately, and everyone else just keeps moving along achieving pretty much anything they want if they set their mind to it. Sure, they fail some, but at least not all the time! And I've had it with everyone trying to sugarcoat it and make it seem like it's not a big deal, because it is. Whenever there's any kind of group project or organization, guess who's the only one not invited every single time? You guessed it, it's me! And they're not bullying me, it's because they know at a subconscious level that I'm not worth the dust beneath my paws, even the ones who have tried to deny this know it, and their actions prove it. Stop lying to me, the evidence is right in front of all of us! Not one thing I attempt ever finishes, and even if it would it'd be a huge mess and so much less than everyone else can do in a fraction of the time and effort. Now you may say, "Oh, I couldn't do what you did!". But you've never tried or been interested have you? Exactly. I don't and can't do even *one thing* halfway decently. Don't give me that 10000 hours crap or whatever, it hasn't worked at all for me and no one else even needs it. It's a myth, and even science has proven that, along with common sense. Practice accounts for maybe 0.1-10% of the difference, the rest is just innate intelligence that you have to be born with, not a fucking thing you can do about it. And everyone here has that in every field except me! I don't even know *one* other person who has this problem, I'm completely alone. Here everyone else is doing all sorts of crazy things and I can't even find a fox picture on the internet after searching for 2 hours with years of experience. I'm always out of the loop, super dull, can barely even think. I do a few things somewhat well but I'm faking it. They consist of a few specific things I've seen other people do and copying it robotically, with literally no understanding. I literally can't do *anything* else. Everyone else can at least do the thing they've been doing all the time for years, usually more than that, but me, nope, not even mediocre at one fucking thing! Not one hobby, not one game, not one subject, nothing! I'm uncharismatic, dull, forgetful, and just utterly incompetent! I'm a born loser, a wannabe in every way, and I just don't know how to play these cards! I get nothing but frustration and failure. This is so fucking unfair! The only thing I'm good at is burdening people with my problems. I used to have a some creativity at least when I was young but of course that went away as I got older and went through puberty and I can't ever even have that back! Damnit, what am I ever going to do with this situation! If I only knew even one other person on the whole planet who could sympathize with me. But no, you're all perfect and flawless and have superpowers compared to me, in real life and online. I need to give up on everything, my every effort is 100% in vain. But I'm not a passive consumer, and I can't just do that! Why am I like that when I don't have what it takes? I have no peace with myself, I can't just accept it, I don't want to waste my whole life in this miserable state. Someone please help me, I am falling apart! And please don't try to feed me more sugarcoated politically correct nonsense, that is not helping! Please, is there anything I can do escape this frustration and have joy in life?

body: Turn to the Lord Jesus Christ.  If you recognize that you had positive traits as a child then you must admit that you have the capacity to accomplish things.  Jesus said: except you humble yourself as a child, ye shall in no wise enter into the kingdom of heaven.  So not only would Jesus suggest you return to as you were as a child, but it's a requirement.

body:
You misinterpreted that part. I honestly haven't really changed in attitude from when I was a child. That ability just went away, and it's not something I gave up, believe me I'd take it back in a heartbeat if I could. But it's not attitude or choice that made it happen, it's a very common and well-known phenomenon and has to do with changes in the brain as you go through puberty. When you're young, it's primed to imagine things and play more so it can learn and absorb information. But when you hit adolescence it changes to be optimized more for logic and rational thinking (which I'm not good at either), so your creative side takes a big hit. It's not something I chose to go through, I'd love to reverse it, but I can't.

And please don't misquote the Lord. If you look at the rest of the passage it's about humility, not literally mimicking everything children do. By that logic we should lie and cheat and steal because children do that naturally like all people. Be careful, bible "verses" are a trick of the very same person who plotted this whole setup to make me feel sub-par so that I would envy and become ungrateful.

parent.body: Turn to the Lord Jesus Christ.  If you recognize that you had positive traits as a child then you must admit that you have the capacity to accomplish things.  Jesus said: except you humble yourself as a child, ye shall in no wise enter into the kingdom of heaven.  So not only would Jesus suggest you return to as you were as a child, but it's a requirement.

post.body: I HAVE FUCKING HAD IT! NOT **ONE** OTHER PERSON HERE HAS A SINGLE FAULT EXCEPT FOR ME! I can't do anything right. Even the smallest things I try to do fall apart immediately, and everyone else just keeps moving along achieving pretty much anything they want if they set their mind to it. Sure, they fail some, but at least not all the time! And I've had it with everyone trying to sugarcoat it and make it seem like it's not a big deal, because it is. Whenever there's any kind of group project or organization, guess who's the only one not invited every single time? You guessed it, it's me! And they're not bullying me, it's because they know at a subconscious level that I'm not worth the dust beneath my paws, even the ones who have tried to deny this know it, and their actions prove it. Stop lying to me, the evidence is right in front of all of us! Not one thing I attempt ever finishes, and even if it would it'd be a huge mess and so much less than everyone else can do in a fraction of the time and effort. Now you may say, "Oh, I couldn't do what you did!". But you've never tried or been interested have you? Exactly. I don't and can't do even *one thing* halfway decently. Don't give me that 10000 hours crap or whatever, it hasn't worked at all for me and no one else even needs it. It's a myth, and even science has proven that, along with common sense. Practice accounts for maybe 0.1-10% of the difference, the rest is just innate intelligence that you have to be born with, not a fucking thing you can do about it. And everyone here has that in every field except me! I don't even know *one* other person who has this problem, I'm completely alone. Here everyone else is doing all sorts of crazy things and I can't even find a fox picture on the internet after searching for 2 hours with years of experience. I'm always out of the loop, super dull, can barely even think. I do a few things somewhat well but I'm faking it. They consist of a few specific things I've seen other people do and copying it robotically, with literally no understanding. I literally can't do *anything* else. Everyone else can at least do the thing they've been doing all the time for years, usually more than that, but me, nope, not even mediocre at one fucking thing! Not one hobby, not one game, not one subject, nothing! I'm uncharismatic, dull, forgetful, and just utterly incompetent! I'm a born loser, a wannabe in every way, and I just don't know how to play these cards! I get nothing but frustration and failure. This is so fucking unfair! The only thing I'm good at is burdening people with my problems. I used to have a some creativity at least when I was young but of course that went away as I got older and went through puberty and I can't ever even have that back! Damnit, what am I ever going to do with this situation! If I only knew even one other person on the whole planet who could sympathize with me. But no, you're all perfect and flawless and have superpowers compared to me, in real life and online. I need to give up on everything, my every effort is 100% in vain. But I'm not a passive consumer, and I can't just do that! Why am I like that when I don't have what it takes? I have no peace with myself, I can't just accept it, I don't want to waste my whole life in this miserable state. Someone please help me, I am falling apart! And please don't try to feed me more sugarcoated politically correct nonsense, that is not helping! Please, is there anything I can do escape this frustration and have joy in life?

post.title: Why am I the only one who isn't perfect?

body:
Sounds like you already accept and understand that you are your biggest problem? Now you just have to recognise that this understanding is in itself a superpower - more valuable than most others.

Most people live their entire lives believing they are the victim of some external, malevolent force that they are powerless to overcome. This is not the case.

If you are your biggest problem - the solution is within your control. Change your perspective, change your life.

+Stoicism

Goodbye. https://ruqqus.com/+The_Cabal/post/d9y9/i-told-you-so-all-the

Remember: History repeats, and the unaware are doomed to repeat it.

body:
In reality, I don't think we actually are below average. I think we're actually above average for even doing anything at all. However, in my case, everyone I know is at the very very top of the pyramid who are the type that really can do anything they put their mind to. I don't know why that is, but I think it's because I have ambitions and similar personality to people who have real extraordinary potential. So I always land with them, being the outlier who doesn't have the extreme giftedness (among *them*, not everyone). Another explanation is that these people usually attain the highest social status, being natural leaders, while the masses are just more shy and tend to follow them around and not speak up much. So since I am an exception, being an active and present person who has more normal levels of giftedness, all the other active people are the ones who are on top of the world, and that's who I end up meeting. In addition, the other people often treat them like gods or idols and me talking to them more normally is probably why they get to know me better.

I suppose since we aren't talented enough to do things for ourselves, having fun is pretty much out of the question for us. However we can still enjoy other things we do have, if you have family, friends, a nice meal, cool stuff you bought, anything really, that's still an option. I really do have a surplus compared to a lot of people. Really immerse yourself in the things you do have and know that you're lucky to have them, and they could be taken away in the snap of a finger. It's not fair to only look at the most elite people in the world, even though to us (me at least) they're the whole world. But the vast majority of people aren't at that level, we just don't know them. All the people we know are just the lucky few who could become the next Einsteins or Beethovens or Picassos or Musks. And whatever the explanation is, try to find more people who aren't so great. That's been a real challenge for me but I found you, so that's something. Don't cut off contact with your old friends and abandon them, but try to cut off any way for you to find out what they're up to or accomplishing since it'll make you feel undermined. I recently unsubscribed from most of the guilds my friends post in for example, because my friends were making 1000000000000 excellent posts all the time and it was bothering me because I can't even make one. I may leave most discord servers too because I don't want to see how many gated projects they're all in that I was the only one not invited to, or how popular they became or what super privilege they attained somewhere, or what they made or did or whatever. I'll just talk to them in DMs and never ask what's happening elsewhere. I suppose only focus on what you do have, not what you don't. If you don't look at your friends' accomplishments, you'll stop thinking about how much better they're doing than you.

parent.body:
Sounds like we're twins or something. I know how it's like, no one is equal, and we just so happened to be born as people below average and there's nothing we can do about it. The only way I keep on going is pretty much trying to kill off my emotions, but even I still feel bad every now and then, no matter how hard I try not to feel like most people tell me, I've been trying for years and I'm still feeling upset I can't do what most people do and my subhuman status makes me undeserving of what most people have. But I do hope maybe one day you'll find something you can do, something you don't dread and is productive.

Also shameless advertising but there's always +Venting if you wanna let out anything there.

I'm a born loser, a wannabe in every way, and I just don't know how to play these cards! I get nothing but frustration and failure. This is so fucking unfair! The only thing I'm good at is burdening people with my problems. I used to have a some creativity at least when I was young but of course that went away as I got older and went through puberty and I can't ever even have that back! Damnit, what am I ever going to do with this situation! If I only knew even one other person on the whole planet who could sympathize with me. But no, you're all perfect and flawless and have superpowers compared to me, in real life and online. I need to give up on everything, my every effort is 100% in vain. But I'm not a passive consumer, and I can't just do that! Why am I like that when I don't have what it takes? I have no peace with myself, I can't just accept it, I don't want to waste my whole life in this miserable state. Someone please help me, I am falling apart! And please don't try to feed me more sugarcoated politically correct nonsense, that is not helping! Please, is there anything I can do escape this frustration and have joy in life?

parent.body:
Sounds like you already accept and understand that you are your biggest problem? Now you just have to recognise that this understanding is in itself a superpower - more valuable than most others.

Most people live their entire lives believing they are the victim of some external, malevolent force that they are powerless to overcome. This is not the case.

If you are your biggest problem - the solution is within your control. Change your perspective, change your life.

+Stoicism

Whenever there's any kind of group project or organization, guess who's the only one not invited every single time? You guessed it, it's me! body:
There is no necessity to change everything about yourself all at once... and so what if you have no natural talents? It's not a prerequisite for success - it just means success may be harder to obtain. 

Start with what you can control - your physical fitness... Routine - diet - working out. Stick to it for 30 days.

+Carnivore

body:
> It's not a prerequisite for success - it just means success may be harder to obtain.

It absolutely is a prerequisite, and not having it means it's *impossible* to obtain. Me, and plenty of people, try as they might, can't ever do anything right, while others breeze along. Contrary to popular belief, practice and effort accounts for, at most, 25% of the difference in ability. That means, at a minimum, *75 percent* of what you can do is determined entirely by what natural talent you have (and a few other minor factors, like learning faster when you're younger). And that's just for side hobbies. For main hobbies and professions, practice and hard work only make about *1-10%* of the difference depending on the field. This definitely reflects my experience. So if you're not born to do it, there's absolutely no hope for you. "10000 hours" and "put your mind to it" only works for the people who have the talent, they just need to hone their skills. For everyone else, this effort works a little bit at first but then you hit a ceiling, and after that it's all in vain. You may be able to robotically copy a few of the methods of the talented people but you will *never* be able to do most of it on your own. Studies have confirmed that success, talent, social status, and intelligence are all almost entirely genetic and fixed at birth. So basically I'm screwed. I'll always have to get someone else to accomplish everything I want for me, which is undesirable for a number of reasons, namely not being able to enjoy it myself, and also loss of control. But others will always be able to do almost anything they want all by themselves. It's not what anyone wants to hear, but unfortunately it's reality.

> Start with what you can control - your physical fitness... Routine - diet - working out. Stick to it for 30 days.

That's been going well for me so far, so that's a positive at least.

That means, at a minimum, *75 percent* of what you can do is determined entirely by what natural talent you have (and a few other minor factors, like learning faster when you're younger). And that's just for side hobbies. For main hobbies and professions, practice and hard work only make about *1-10%* of the difference depending on the field. This definitely reflects my experience. So if you're not born to do it, there's absolutely no hope for you. "10000 hours" and "put your mind to it" only works for the people who have the talent, they just need to hone their skills. For everyone else, this effort works a little bit at first but then you hit a ceiling, and after that it's all in vain. You may be able to robotically copy a few of the methods of the talented people but you will *never* be able to do most of it on your own. Studies have confirmed that success, talent, social status, and intelligence are all almost entirely genetic and fixed at birth. So basically I'm screwed. I'll always have to get someone else to accomplish everything I want for me, which is undesirable for a number of reasons, namely not being able to enjoy it myself, and also loss of control. But others will always be able to do almost anything they want all by themselves. It's not what anyone wants to hear, but unfortunately it's reality.

> Start with what you can control - your physical fitness... Routine - diet - working out. Stick to it for 30 days.

That's been going well for me so far, so that's a positive at least.

post.body: I HAVE FUCKING HAD IT! NOT **ONE** OTHER PERSON HERE HAS A SINGLE FAULT EXCEPT FOR ME! I can't do anything right. Even the smallest things I try to do fall apart immediately, and everyone else just keeps moving along achieving pretty much anything they want if they set their mind to it. Sure, they fail some, but at least not all the time! And I've had it with everyone trying to sugarcoat it and make it seem like it's not a big deal, because it is. Whenever there's any kind of group project or organization, guess who's the only one not invited every single time? You guessed it, it's me! And they're not bullying me, it's because they know at a subconscious level that I'm not worth the dust beneath my paws, even the ones who have tried to deny this know it, and their actions prove it. Stop lying to me, the evidence is right in front of all of us! Not one thing I attempt ever finishes, and even if it would it'd be a huge mess and so much less than everyone else can do in a fraction of the time and effort. Now you may say, "Oh, I couldn't do what you did!". But you've never tried or been interested have you? Exactly. I don't and can't do even *one thing* halfway decently. Don't give me that 10000 hours crap or whatever, it hasn't worked at all for me and no one else even needs it. It's a myth, and even science has proven that, along with common sense. Practice accounts for maybe 0.1-10% of the difference, the rest is just innate intelligence that you have to be born with, not a fucking thing you can do about it. And everyone here has that in every field except me! I don't even know *one* other person who has this problem, I'm completely alone. Here everyone else is doing all sorts of crazy things and I can't even find a fox picture on the internet after searching for 2 hours with years of experience. I'm always out of the loop, super dull, can barely even think. I do a few things somewhat well but I'm faking it. They consist of a few specific things I've seen other people do and copying it robotically, with literally no understanding. I literally can't do *anything* else. Everyone else can at least do the thing they've been doing all the time for years, usually more than that, but me, nope, not even mediocre at one fucking thing! Not one hobby, not one game, not one subject, nothing! I'm uncharismatic, dull, forgetful, and just utterly incompetent! I'm a born loser, a wannabe in every way, and I just don't know how to play these cards! I get nothing but frustration and failure. This is so fucking unfair! The only thing I'm good at is burdening people with my problems. I used to have a some creativity at least when I was young but of course that went away as I got older and went through puberty and I can't ever even have that back! Damnit, what am I ever going to do with this situation! If I only knew even one other person on the whole planet who could sympathize with me. But no, you're all perfect and flawless and have superpowers compared to me, in real life and online. I need to give up on everything, my every effort is 100% in vain. But I'm not a passive consumer, and I can't just do that! Why am I like that when I don't have what it takes? I have no peace with myself, I can't just accept it, I don't want to waste my whole life in this miserable state. Someone please help me, I am falling apart! And please don't try to feed me more sugarcoated politically correct nonsense, that is not helping! Please, is there anything I can do escape this frustration and have joy in life?

body:
I *have* tried hard and practiced a lot. But my results never showed :{ It's not working for me. That's not to say it doesn't *help*. Indeed I am better than I used to be at things. But it's not going to be enough to get me to where I *want* to be. Whereas most people I know do have enough talent to get them to a good enough level.

It's not fair to judge a fish by it's ability to climb a tree, but that fish might also just want to climb a tree.

body: It's not a mind virus. I once thought the same as you, but after making no progress for years I realized it just wasn't realistic. It really is impossible for me to accomplish many of the things the more talented people are doing. It's not what anyone wants to hear, but it's reality, people are *not* equal and life isn't fair. However, don't change your attitude, because you might have a shot at whatever it is you want to do, and your confidence is a good thing in case you are capable. Unfortunately for me, it has been shown that I am not.

body: I really don't think it's possible to have most people thinking you're smart and be like "but actually I'm retarded". If you're faking it that well, it may not be quite as fake as you think. Have more confidence in your actions.

parent.body:
I don't think it's a learning disability, I can learn to copy other people like a robot just fine. I think it's that I'm just stupid and can't think for myself. But unfortunately most people think I'm really smart because they never bothered trying the things I did. But if they did they'd instantly zoom past me. Out of those who *do* have any interest, even mild, I'm always the lowest of the low. And it bothers me because I want to do things, mostly just for myself, and I can never get anything done but hours of frustration. And everyone else does it all the time just fine, usually well enough that it looks professional to me. And it takes a fraction of the time it does me.

> Like, you can't choose any of them or what?

I can't even find new ones at all, something everyone else in +foxes does multiple times a day with zero effort. And even when I do then I can't make up a good title because my brain doesn't work.

body: I don't think I misquoted the Lord, nor do i think i took what he said out of context.  Obviously it was about humility, hence why the word humble was part of what I quoted; but just because his main point was humility, does not mean that we should only be like a child as it relates to humility. There are numerous other references that suggest we should return to the mindset of a child, whether stated directly or indirectly.
body_html: I don't think I misquoted the Lord, nor do i think i took what he said out of context. Obviously it was about humility, hence why the word humble was part of what I quoted; but just because his main point was humility, does not mean that we should only be like a child as it relates to humility. There are numerous other references that suggest we should return to the mindset of a child, whether stated directly or indirectly.

guild.description: The yanking feature should not exist.
guild.name: Vacuum

parent.body:
You misinterpreted that part. I honestly haven't really changed in attitude from when I was a child. That ability just went away, and it's not something I gave up, believe me I'd take it back in a heartbeat if I could. But it's not attitude or choice that made it happen, it's a very common and well-known phenomenon and has to do with changes in the brain as you go through puberty. When you're young, it's primed to imagine things and play more so it can learn and absorb information. But when you hit adolescence it changes to be optimized more for logic and rational thinking (which I'm not good at either), so your creative side takes a big hit. It's not something I chose to go through, I'd love to reverse it, but I can't.

And please don't misquote the Lord. If you look at the rest of the passage it's about humility, not literally mimicking everything children do. By that logic we should lie and cheat and steal because children do that naturally like all people. Be careful, bible "verses" are a trick of the very same person who plotted this whole setup to make me feel sub-par so that I would envy and become ungrateful.

That ability just went away, and it's not something I gave up, believe me I'd take it back in a heartbeat if I could. When you're young, it's primed to imagine things and play more so it can learn and absorb information. But when you hit adolescence it changes to be optimized more for logic and rational thinking (which I'm not good at either), so your creative side takes a big hit. It's not something I chose to go through, I'd love to reverse it, but I can't.

And please don't misquote the Lord. If you look at the rest of the passage it's about humility, not literally mimicking everything children do. By that logic we should lie and cheat and steal because children do that naturally like all people. Be careful, bible "verses" are a trick of the very same person who plotted this whole setup to make me feel sub-par so that I would envy and become ungrateful.

post.body: I HAVE FUCKING HAD IT! NOT **ONE** OTHER PERSON HERE HAS A SINGLE FAULT EXCEPT FOR ME! I can't do anything right. Even the smallest things I try to do fall apart immediately, and everyone else just keeps moving along achieving pretty much anything they want if they set their mind to it. Sure, they fail some, but at least not all the time! And I've had it with everyone trying to sugarcoat it and make it seem like it's not a big deal, because it is. Whenever there's any kind of group project or organization, guess who's the only one not invited every single time? You guessed it, it's me! And they're not bullying me, it's because they know at a subconscious level that I'm not worth the dust beneath my paws, even the ones who have tried to deny this know it, and their actions prove it. Stop lying to me, the evidence is right in front of all of us! Not one thing I attempt ever finishes, and even if it would it'd be a huge mess and so much less than everyone else can do in a fraction of the time and effort. Now you may say, "Oh, I couldn't do what you did!". But you've never tried or been interested have you? Exactly. I don't and can't do even *one thing* halfway decently. Don't give me that 10000 hours crap or whatever, it hasn't worked at all for me and no one else even needs it. It's a myth, and even science has proven that, along with common sense. Practice accounts for maybe 0.1-10% of the difference, the rest is just innate intelligence that you have to be born with, not a fucking thing you can do about it. And everyone here has that in every field except me! I don't even know *one* other person who has this problem, I'm completely alone. Here everyone else is doing all sorts of crazy things and I can't even find a fox picture on the internet after searching for 2 hours with years of experience. I'm always out of the loop, super dull, can barely even think. I do a few things somewhat well but I'm faking it. They consist of a few specific things I've seen other people do and copying it robotically, with literally no understanding. I literally can't do *anything* else. Everyone else can at least do the thing they've been doing all the time for years, usually more than that, but me, nope, not even mediocre at one fucking thing! Not one hobby, not one game, not one subject, nothing! I'm uncharismatic, dull, forgetful, and just utterly incompetent! I'm a born loser, a wannabe in every way, and I just don't know how to play these cards! I get nothing but frustration and failure. This is so fucking unfair! The only thing I'm good at is burdening people with my problems. I used to have a some creativity at least when I was young but of course that went away as I got older and went through puberty and I can't ever even have that back! Damnit, what am I ever going to do with this situation! If I only knew even one other person on the whole planet who could sympathize with me. But no, you're all perfect and flawless and have superpowers compared to me, in real life and online. I need to give up on everything, my every effort is 100% in vain. But I'm not a passive consumer, and I can't just do that! Why am I like that when I don't have what it takes? I have no peace with myself, I can't just accept it, I don't want to waste my whole life in this miserable state. Someone please help me, I am falling apart! And please don't try to feed me more sugarcoated politically correct nonsense, that is not helping! Please, is there anything I can do escape this frustration and have joy in life?

body: I'm probably still below average then because I don't really do anything, and when I do it's not as great. Remember when I said I'm undeserving of things others have? Well having friends and all that is too late for me. Several years ago I cut everyone off and I made no effort to befriend anyone, I never learned to communicate properly and I have a bland life, so trying to force anyone to talk to me would be extremely selfish. I even got ran out of one discord server for not having a job because of how socially unacceptable that is. I only have online friends who despite me a horrible person, they still want to talk to me anyway. But I have noticed they're all social rejects as well, a common theme among them most people think they're awful people. Like me. And since I don't have a job I can't buy things for myself, all I have is to sit around and stare at my screen as a way escape my reality. But that's much more difficult compared to a year ago, as internet is now heavily tied to real life it seems.

guild.name: Vacuum

parent.body:
In reality, I don't think we actually are below average. I think we're actually above average for even doing anything at all. However, in my case, everyone I know is at the very very top of the pyramid who are the type that really can do anything they put their mind to. I don't know why that is, but I think it's because I have ambitions and similar personality to people who have real extraordinary potential. So I always land with them, being the outlier who doesn't have the extreme giftedness (among *them*, not everyone). Another explanation is that these people usually attain the highest social status, being natural leaders, while the masses are just more shy and tend to follow them around and not speak up much. So since I am an exception, being an active and present person who has more normal levels of giftedness, all the other active people are the ones who are on top of the world, and that's who I end up meeting. In addition, the other people often treat them like gods or idols and me talking to them more normally is probably why they get to know me better.

I suppose since we aren't talented enough to do things for ourselves, having fun is pretty much out of the question for us. However we can still enjoy other things we do have, if you have family, friends, a nice meal, cool stuff you bought, anything really, that's still an option. I really do have a surplus compared to a lot of people. Really immerse yourself in the things you do have and know that you're lucky to have them, and they could be taken away in the snap of a finger. It's not fair to only look at the most elite people in the world, even though to us (me at least) they're the whole world. But the vast majority of people aren't at that level, we just don't know them. All the people we know are just the lucky few who could become the next Einsteins or Beethovens or Picassos or Musks. And whatever the explanation is, try to find more people who aren't so great. That's been a real challenge for me but I found you, so that's something. Don't cut off contact with your old friends and abandon them, but try to cut off any way for you to find out what they're up to or accomplishing since it'll make you feel undermined. I recently unsubscribed from most of the guilds my friends post in for example, because my friends were making 1000000000000 excellent posts all the time and it was bothering me because I can't even make one. I may leave most discord servers too because I don't want to see how many gated projects they're all in that I was the only one not invited to, or how popular they became or what super privilege they attained somewhere, or what they made or did or whatever. I'll just talk to them in DMs and never ask what's happening elsewhere. I suppose only focus on what you do have, not what you don't. If you don't look at your friends' accomplishments, you'll stop thinking about how much better they're doing than you.

body:
I'm not exactly an outcast but everyone I know is worth infinitely more than me. They're all at the very top leading everything and people all listening to them and I've always been a nobody who no one takes seriously. Even people I know keep me out of more "important" things because I'm not worthy of it. So I can still relate to that.

But don't cut anyone off anymore. I have a friend who did that and he's even more miserable now, and he's just blank and doesn't exist. Before, he could still savor the good he had in life, but now he gave all that up and only suffers the bad things. You may not have as much of an abundance of luck and success as everyone else, but don't waste what you do have. And please don't abandon your friends, that's just selfish. If you can't stand to be around them at least call them or text them where you can be isolated from whatever amazing things they're doing.

Practice accounts for maybe 0.1-10% of the difference, the rest is just innate intelligence that you have to be born with, not a fucking thing you can do about it. And everyone here has that in every field except me! I don't even know one other person who has this problem, I'm completely alone. Here everyone else is doing all sorts of crazy things and I can't even find a fox picture on the internet after searching for 2 hours with years of experience. I'm always out of the loop, super dull, can barely even think. I do a few things somewhat well but I'm faking it. They consist of a few specific things I've seen other people do and copying it robotically, with literally no understanding. I literally can't do anything else. Everyone else can at least do the thing they've been doing all the time for years, usually more than that, but me, nope, not even mediocre at one fucking thing! Not one hobby, not one game, not one subject, nothing! I'm uncharismatic, dull, forgetful, and just utterly incompetent! I'm a born loser, a wannabe in every way, and I just don't know how to play these cards! I get nothing but frustration and failure. This is so fucking unfair! The only thing I'm good at is burdening people with my problems. I used to have a some creativity at least when I was young but of course that went away as I got older and went through puberty and I can't ever even have that back! Damnit, what am I ever going to do with this situation! If I only knew even one other person on the whole planet who could sympathize with me. But no, you're all perfect and flawless and have superpowers compared to me, in real life and online. I need to give up on everything, my every effort is 100% in vain. But I'm not a passive consumer, and I can't just do that! Why am I like that when I don't have what it takes? I have no peace with myself, I can't just accept it, I don't want to waste my whole life in this miserable state. Someone please help me, I am falling apart! And please don't try to feed me more sugarcoated politically correct nonsense, that is not helping! Please, is there anything I can do escape this frustration and have joy in life?

body: It's fake because I can mimick a specific exact process from someone who's actually good at something, but I could never come up with it on my own, which if I want to build my own things is necessary. For example I can score very high in math because I copy exactly how someone else does the problems. But if I wanted to be a mathematician where I actually have to figure things out and think outside the box even a little, it's game over. Then I could learn from others who actually are good how to solve something, and I could then be able to solve those exact type of problems, but never do it myself like they can, which is an essential skill to be able to actually do things on your own. A silly example, but one I figure most people can understand. So I'm actually really stupid and bad at everything, I just tend to systematically copy what the actually smart people do so it *looks* like I'm smarter than I am, but it wasn't really me who did any of the thinking or the work behind it.

body: Well it's a stone cold fact that in every single instance of a ruqqus community project, I was the *only* user I know and the *only* active user on ruqqus not invited immediately at the very beginning. So, there must be something negative that sets me apart from everyone else, as the probability of that happening by pure luck is **astronomically** tiny. Even the people who try to spoonfeed me "self-esteem" are subconsciously aware of it, as they end up doing the exact same thing. I don't think me noticing myself never even coming close to doing something right while others succeed all the time with much less time and effort is just catastrophizing. It's clear that others can see it too. All I can be good for is ruining everything.

Practice accounts for maybe 0.1-10% of the difference, the rest is just innate intelligence that you have to be born with, not a fucking thing you can do about it. And everyone here has that in every field except me! I don't even know *one* other person who has this problem, I'm completely alone. Here everyone else is doing all sorts of crazy things and I can't even find a fox picture on the internet after searching for 2 hours with years of experience. I'm always out of the loop, super dull, can barely even think. I do a few things somewhat well but I'm faking it. They consist of a few specific things I've seen other people do and copying it robotically, with literally no understanding. I literally can't do *anything* else. Everyone else can at least do the thing they've been doing all the time for years, usually more than that, but me, nope, not even mediocre at one fucking thing! Not one hobby, not one game, not one subject, nothing! I'm uncharismatic, dull, forgetful, and just utterly incompetent! I'm a born loser, a wannabe in every way, and I just don't know how to play these cards! I get nothing but frustration and failure. This is so fucking unfair! The only thing I'm good at is burdening people with my problems. I used to have a some creativity at least when I was young but of course that went away as I got older and went through puberty and I can't ever even have that back! Damnit, what am I ever going to do with this situation! If I only knew even one other person on the whole planet who could sympathize with me. But no, you're all perfect and flawless and have superpowers compared to me, in real life and online. I need to give up on everything, my every effort is 100% in vain. But I'm not a passive consumer, and I can't just do that! Why am I like that when I don't have what it takes? I have no peace with myself, I can't just accept it, I don't want to waste my whole life in this miserable state. Someone please help me, I am falling apart! And please don't try to feed me more sugarcoated politically correct nonsense, that is not helping! Please, is there anything I can do escape this frustration and have joy in life?

body:
>Well it's a stone cold fact that in every single instance of a ruqqus community project, I was the only user I know and the only active user on ruqqus not invited immediately at the very beginning.

Even if that is true, ruqqus is just one tiny aspect of what you do and who you are. It's not like your whole life and being are just ruined because not everything on ruqqus is working out for you. If the community projects aren't working out for you, either because you aren't being properly appreciated, or because what you say is true and you aren't making good contributions, just do something else you find meaningful. Your entire life is not defined by what goes on on this website.

But no, you're all perfect and flawless and have superpowers compared to me, in real life and online. I need to give up on everything, my every effort is 100% in vain. But I'm not a passive consumer, and I can't just do that! Why am I like that when I don't have what it takes? I have no peace with myself, I can't just accept it, I don't want to waste my whole life in this miserable state. Someone please help me, I am falling apart! And please don't try to feed me more sugarcoated politically correct nonsense, that is not helping! Please, is there anything I can do escape this frustration and have joy in life?
post.title: Why am I the only one who isn't perfect?

author.bio: Hi there, I'm Reverie, or Gray, whatever you prefer. I'm just here to look at memes and pretty pictures but sometimes I might comment on things. Sometimes my opinions, sometimes stupid thoughts, or both in one.
author.bio_html: Hi there, I'm Reverie, or Gray, whatever you prefer. I'm just here to look at memes and pretty pictures but sometimes I might comment on things. Sometimes my opinions, sometimes stupid thoughts, or both in one.

body: I know how that is, I am rarely taken seriously and not trusted with anything. It is very rarely people tell me they appreciate a trait I have.  Being blank and not existing sounds like the point I've already gotten to long ago. I'm not going to go out of my to enjoy anything I don't deserve. I do nothing with my life so why should I be happy. I'll be happy when I actually work for it and earn it. My problem before I became this way is I used to have the "I'm human so I am entitled to being treated nicely and deserve whatever I want" mind set and I couldn't understand why no one at all could stand me and why everyone told me I deserve to suffer. But I understand that all now. So now instead of being frustrated about why things don't go my way, I'm now calm and don't get emotional outbreaks anymore as I understand and accept I must work for everything. So that is why I hope we both can find something to do, to keep our mind on and be content. Knowing we finally have our place in the world. I think as long as I one day have a stable job and a husband I will be as happy as I always wanted to be.

parent.body:
I'm not exactly an outcast but everyone I know is worth infinitely more than me. They're all at the very top leading everything and people all listening to them and I've always been a nobody who no one takes seriously. Even people I know keep me out of more "important" things because I'm not worthy of it. So I can still relate to that.

But don't cut anyone off anymore. I have a friend who did that and he's even more miserable now, and he's just blank and doesn't exist. Before, he could still savor the good he had in life, but now he gave all that up and only suffers the bad things. You may not have as much of an abundance of luck and success as everyone else, but don't waste what you do have. And please don't abandon your friends, that's just selfish. If you can't stand to be around them at least call them or text them where you can be isolated from whatever amazing things they're doing.

post.body: I HAVE FUCKING HAD IT! NOT **ONE** OTHER PERSON HERE HAS A SINGLE FAULT EXCEPT FOR ME! I can't do anything right. Even the smallest things I try to do fall apart immediately, and everyone else just keeps moving along achieving pretty much anything they want if they set their mind to it. Sure, they fail some, but at least not all the time! And I've had it with everyone trying to sugarcoat it and make it seem like it's not a big deal, because it is. Whenever there's any kind of group project or organization, guess who's the only one not invited every single time? You guessed it, it's me! And they're not bullying me, it's because they know at a subconscious level that I'm not worth the dust beneath my paws, even the ones who have tried to deny this know it, and their actions prove it. Stop lying to me, the evidence is right in front of all of us! Not one thing I attempt ever finishes, and even if it would it'd be a huge mess and so much less than everyone else can do in a fraction of the time and effort. Now you may say, "Oh, I couldn't do what you did!". But you've never tried or been interested have you? Exactly. I don't and can't do even *one thing* halfway decently. Don't give me that 10000 hours crap or whatever, it hasn't worked at all for me and no one else even needs it. It's a myth, and even science has proven that, along with common sense. Practice accounts for maybe 0.1-10% of the difference, the rest is just innate intelligence that you have to be born with, not a fucking thing you can do about it. And everyone here has that in every field except me! I don't even know *one* other person who has this problem, I'm completely alone. Here everyone else is doing all sorts of crazy things and I can't even find a fox picture on the internet after searching for 2 hours with years of experience. I'm always out of the loop, super dull, can barely even think. I do a few things somewhat well but I'm faking it. They consist of a few specific things I've seen other people do and copying it robotically, with literally no understanding. I literally can't do *anything* else. Everyone else can at least do the thing they've been doing all the time for years, usually more than that, but me, nope, not even mediocre at one fucking thing! Not one hobby, not one game, not one subject, nothing! I'm uncharismatic, dull, forgetful, and just utterly incompetent! I'm a born loser, a wannabe in every way, and I just don't know how to play these cards! I get nothing but frustration and failure. This is so fucking unfair! The only thing I'm good at is burdening people with my problems. I used to have a some creativity at least when I was young but of course that went away as I got older and went through puberty and I can't ever even have that back! Damnit, what am I ever going to do with this situation! If I only knew even one other person on the whole planet who could sympathize with me. But no, you're all perfect and flawless and have superpowers compared to me, in real life and online. I need to give up on everything, my every effort is 100% in vain. But I'm not a passive consumer, and I can't just do that! Why am I like that when I don't have what it takes? I have no peace with myself, I can't just accept it, I don't want to waste my whole life in this miserable state. Someone please help me, I am falling apart! And please don't try to feed me more sugarcoated politically correct nonsense, that is not helping! Please, is there anything I can do escape this frustration and have joy in life?

body: True, but it's hard just being a normal mortal when everyone you know is a god. There's a ton of things I want to do that I am simply not capable of, yet for them they can do the impossible if they merely want to. I have some good qualities but I also have many serious flaws, and lack of talent and intelligence is one of them, and also lack of charisma which causes people to distrust me in general.

body:
I wish the best for you. Your goals are more reasonable for the average person and I have little doubt you'll obtain them. However you sound like you've already given up, and you're *not* going to get those things by doing that. Go back to existing and living life, just with a more mature mindset.

As for me, I want to do things that only "those" types of people who are higher being and have few faults are able to accomplish. That is every single person I am friends with. They can do things, but I cannot and that will probably never change. The only solution I can see is to somehow change all my passions, which isn't exactly simple.

Also, find me on Discord if you want to talk further. I'm often not online but I should be easy to find in the ruqqus server, I have the same username.
body_html:
I wish the best for you. Your goals are more reasonable for the average person and I have little doubt you'll obtain them. However you sound like you've already given up, and you're not going to get those things by doing that. Go back to existing and living life, just with a more mature mindset.

As for me, I want to do things that only "those" types of people who are higher being and have few faults are able to accomplish. That is every single person I am friends with. They can do things, but I cannot and that will probably never change. The only solution I can see is to somehow change all my passions, which isn't exactly simple.

Also, find me on Discord if you want to talk further. I'm often not online but I should be easy to find in the ruqqus server, I have the same username.

I have no peace with myself, I can't just accept it, I don't want to waste my whole life in this miserable state. Someone please help me, I am falling apart! And please don't try to feed me more sugarcoated politically correct nonsense, that is not helping! Please, is there anything I can do escape this frustration and have joy in life?
post.title: Why am I the only one who isn't perfect?

body:
Nobody is perfect and nobody wants to hang out with an attention-whore downer.
Start by taking 100% responsibility and stop yourself from talking/thinking about things negatively, you'll change in time.
You obviously can, since you've changed from when you were a kid to today.
But knowing your type you probably won't take any of this advice and gloss over it.
In which case you probably didn't want any advice you just want someone you can complain to.

post.body: I HAVE FUCKING HAD IT! NOT **ONE** OTHER PERSON HERE HAS A SINGLE FAULT EXCEPT FOR ME! I can't do anything right. Even the smallest things I try to do fall apart immediately, and everyone else just keeps moving along achieving pretty much anything they want if they set their mind to it. Sure, they fail some, but at least not all the time! And I've had it with everyone trying to sugarcoat it and make it seem like it's not a big deal, because it is. Whenever there's any kind of group project or organization, guess who's the only one not invited every single time? You guessed it, it's me! And they're not bullying me, it's because they know at a subconscious level that I'm not worth the dust beneath my paws, even the ones who have tried to deny this know it, and their actions prove it. Stop lying to me, the evidence is right in front of all of us! Not one thing I attempt ever finishes, and even if it would it'd be a huge mess and so much less than everyone else can do in a fraction of the time and effort. Now you may say, "Oh, I couldn't do what you did!". But you've never tried or been interested have you? Exactly. I don't and can't do even *one thing* halfway decently. Don't give me that 10000 hours crap or whatever, it hasn't worked at all for me and no one else even needs it. It's a myth, and even science has proven that, along with common sense. Practice accounts for maybe 0.1-10% of the difference, the rest is just innate intelligence that you have to be born with, not a fucking thing you can do about it. And everyone here has that in every field except me! I don't even know *one* other person who has this problem, I'm completely alone. Here everyone else is doing all sorts of crazy things and I can't even find a fox picture on the internet after searching for 2 hours with years of experience. I'm always out of the loop, super dull, can barely even think. I do a few things somewhat well but I'm faking it. They consist of a few specific things I've seen other people do and copying it robotically, with literally no understanding. I literally can't do *anything* else. Everyone else can at least do the thing they've been doing all the time for years, usually more than that, but me, nope, not even mediocre at one fucking thing! Not one hobby, not one game, not one subject, nothing! I'm uncharismatic, dull, forgetful, and just utterly incompetent! I'm a born loser, a wannabe in every way, and I just don't know how to play these cards! I get nothing but frustration and failure. This is so fucking unfair! The only thing I'm good at is burdening people with my problems. I used to have a some creativity at least when I was young but of course that went away as I got older and went through puberty and I can't ever even have that back! Damnit, what am I ever going to do with this situation! If I only knew even one other person on the whole planet who could sympathize with me. But no, you're all perfect and flawless and have superpowers compared to me, in real life and online. I need to give up on everything, my every effort is 100% in vain. But I'm not a passive consumer, and I can't just do that! Why am I like that when I don't have what it takes? I have no peace with myself, I can't just accept it, I don't want to waste my whole life in this miserable state. Someone please help me, I am falling apart! And please don't try to feed me more sugarcoated politically correct nonsense, that is not helping! Please, is there anything I can do escape this frustration and have joy in life?
